required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Gut Microbial Substrate Switch to Improve Metabolic Health

brief_summary.textblock:
Based on previous research of the investigators group, the investigators hypothesize that slowly fermentable fibers with a high degree of polymerization that increase SCFA specifically in the distal colon are expected to have higher potential for influencing host metabolism and metabolic health by improving adipose tissue function, preventing lipid overflow and hepatic as well as skeletal muscle fat accumulation thereby improving insulin sensitivity.
The objective of this randomized clinical trial is to test, whether the a dietary fiber product containing different physiological acting fibers reverses peripheral and hepatic insulin resistance in overweight/obese insulin resistant participants.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: The change of peripheral insulin sensitivity as assessed by a hyperinsulinaemic-euglycemic clamp

secondary_outcome.measure: hepatic and adipose tissue insulin sensitivity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in hepatic and adipose tissue insulin sensitivity as assessed by a hyperinsulinaemic-euglycemic clamp

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in energy expenditure as measured via ventilated hood system

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in substrate oxidation as measured via ventilated hood system

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in faecal and circulating SCFA

secondary_outcome.measure: Faecal microbiota composition and in vitro microbial activity testing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in faecal microbiota composition as assessed via 16s rRNA gene sequencing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in fin vitro microbial activity testing as assessed using an in vitro model of the human colon

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in circulating hormones in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in metabolites in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.measure: Circulating inflammatory markers such as TNF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in inflammatory markers in peripheral blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in body weight in kg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in body compostion as assessed using DEXA scans

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 12 week after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in liver fat content as assessed by proton magnetic resonance spectrometry

arm_group.description: 15 g for 2 weeks, followed by 30 g for 10 weeks
